sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"聪明的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bright, clever, wise, brilliant, intelligent, ingenious, smart, shrewd
means: bright ： 口语常用词，多指年轻人，尤指小孩思路敏捷，理解力强，机灵等。
clever ： 强调头脑灵活，接受新事物快，有智有谋，但不一定暗示全面妥当地考虑问题。
wise ： 侧重不是一般的聪明伶俐，而是有远见，有智慧，能明智地处理问题。
brilliant ： 指人的才华出众，思路敏捷，常令人赞叹不已。
intelligent ： 正式用词，指在理解新的、抽象东西或处理解决问题时，智力超过一般常人。
ingenious ： 指思路敏捷，并暗示有创造与发明的才能和技巧。
smart ： 普通用词，与bright和clever的意思很相近，但更强调机灵。
shrewd ： 指精明老练，有头脑，善于判断，把握有利机会。

sentence.Network_en: Northbridge is a cool, calculating and clever criminal who could strike again.
sentence.Network_cn: 诺思布里奇是个头脑冷静、诡计多端、阴险狡诈的罪犯，他可能还会犯案。

sentence.Network_en: Rowe does a very clever riff on the nature of prejudice.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗就偏见的本质讲了一番很精辟的话。

sentence.Network_en: Even clever people are not terribly clever when put on the spot.
sentence.Network_cn: 即便是聪明人在面对难题时也未必就能表现得特别聪明。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to express one's belief that a person is annoyingly proud of their intelligence or skill, and that they might overreach themselves
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)未免太聪明了，卖弄小聪明

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'quick to catch hold', only recorded in this period): perhaps of Dutch or Low German origin, and related to cleave. In the late 16th cent. the term came to mean (probably through dialect use) 'manually skilful'; the sense 'possessing mental agility' dates from the early 18th cent

encyclopedia.content: 词义 clever [ˈklevə] adj. 能干的； 聪明的； 伶俐的； 灵巧的 [美方]性情温良的， 和蔼可亲的 [美方]英俊的； 壮健的； 风采优雅的 be clever at 擅长于； 善于使用 clever fingers 巧手， 妙手 继承用法 cleverish adj. 有小聪明的， 灵巧的 cleverishly adv. cleverly adv. [方]完全， 全然 词性变化 clever [ˈklevə] adj. [美俚]壮健， 结实 cleverness n. 习惯用语 be as clever as th

entry.tran: 聪明的;聪颖的;智商高的
entry.def: Someone who is clever is intelligent and able to understand things easily or plan things well.

example.ex: My sister was always a lot cleverer than I was...
example.tran: 我妹妹向来比我聪明许多。

entry.def: A clever idea, book, or invention is extremely effective and shows the skill of the people involved.

example.tran: 构思巧妙、扣人心弦的小说

example.ex: A colleague of mine in Milan devised the following very clever little experiment.
example.tran: 我在米兰的一个同事设计了下面这个非常巧妙的小实验。

entry.tran: 聪明过头的;过分聪明的
entry.def: If someone is too clever by half, they are very clever and they show their cleverness in a way that annoys other people.

example.ex: His many admirers describe him as clever: his enemies as too clever by half.
example.tran: 崇拜他的人很多说他聪明;恨他的人则说他聪明过了头。

means.word_mean: 1. skillful (or showing skill) in adapting means to ends;

sentences.sentence: "cool prudence and sensitive selfishness along with quick perception of what is possible--these distinguish an adroit politician"

means.word_mean: 2. showing self-interest and shrewdness in dealing with others;

sentences.sentence: "you are a clever man...you reason well and your wit is bold"-Bram Stoker
"the cunning maneuvers leading to his success"

Sentence.sentence: Financiers who were not as clever as they thought they were?
And clever as Mr Obama's advisers are, history suggests they will be bad at this

The reaction to his death, with people leaving candles and flowers outside Apple stores and politicians singing praises on the internet, is proof that Mr Jobs had become something much more significant than just a clever money-maker.
To find out if the female dolphin is cleverer than the male one.

sentences.cn: 杰克是个聪明伶俐的学生。

jushi.chinese: 吉姆是一名灵巧的工人。

jushi.english: She is a very clever girl; she will do well in life.
jushi.chinese: 她是个非常聪明的女孩,日后会成功的。
